intro: Psychotria oresbia, commonly known as the "Cuban morning glory," is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly Cuba. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep red. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub or vine, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a glossy texture. Psychotria oresbia is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
